column3: If the man gone racing, then who is going to direct EF?

O m g . hats off to you tom . I can remember us all racing in the under 16 s . traveling all the way round the UK just to get your points and just race the same 5 people every time . all are family sat in the rain . good old days . take it easy mate . David Anderson
Hopefully Rusty is OK. Must be disappointed üòû
I now know why EF hasn't won a stage this year... with that guy shouting in your ear like that no one would want to be in the position to win LOL

First the kit got my attention.¬†But I also¬†like the Rapha videos, always¬†top-quality and cinematic. I am now growing fond of this Team and riders. But I like off-road events more. TdF is now a TV/Media/Marketing monster, it repels me. With Charly shouting like a mad man in his earpiece, I guess Rigo is now irreversibly deaf.
Holy @$#% if I had that #@%$ being yelled at me in the middle of my effort I'd probably lose it. Ridiculous. I cannot see how this would help anyone achieve their best result.
I like the part where he says ALLEZ RIGO
Vamos Rigo!! Los tres pr√≥ximos d√≠as son de vos.

I guess they know mentality of the cyclists and use best methods to motivate them, but personally if I'd be hearing directions in my ear like :"Common anon, common anon . Alle, alle" I'd just stop.I remember me calling my husky in similar way.

Great video. The depth of a team in world class cycling starts with direction. This was a good example of taking personal experience as riders into melding a team from all that experience . Exactly how it works. Great Team,Great Ethos!
Common Rigo, common Rigo alle, alle
